titlestmt.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory of the Diane Ravitch Papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by Aparna Mukherjee

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-14T15:01-0800

physdesc.extent: 63 manuscript boxes, 2 oversize boxes, 45 digital files (.002 GB)

did.abstract: The Diane Ravitch papers consist of speeches and writings, correspondence, printed matter, reports, and studies relating to education in the United States. She is a professor, prolific writer, and an advocate of improvements in American education. Collection includes research materials used by her for writing books

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Diane Ravitch papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2003, with additions through 2008.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Houston, Texas
B.A. from Wellesley College, Massachusetts
Author, The Great School Wars, New York City, 1805-1873

eventgrp.event: Received a Ph.D. in history of American education, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, Columbia University, New York
Received a Delta Kappa Gamma Award for the Great School Wars: New York City, 1805-1973

chronitem.event: Author, The Revisionists Revised
Member, National Academy of Education

eventgrp.event: Trustee, New York Public Library
Author, The Troubled Crusade: American Education, 1945-1980
Director, John Dewey Foundation

chronitem.event: Member, Society of American Historians
Selected as a Phi Beta Kappa Visiting Scholar

eventgrp.event: Author, The Schools We Deserve
Member, American Academy of Arts and Sciences

chronitem.event: Awarded, Henry Allen Moe Prize in Humanities by the American Philosophical Society
Author (with Chester E. Finn, Jr.), What Do Our 17-Year-Olds Know?

eventgrp.event: Advised Teachers Solidarity and the Ministry of Education in Poland
Received the Wellesley College Alumnae Achievement Award
Editor, The American Reader
Awarded a medal by the Polish Government for the work on behalf of Solidarity

chronitem.event: Assistant Secretary of Education and Counselor to the Secretary of Education Lamar Alexander in the administration of President George H. W. Bush
Edited (with Abigail Thernstrom), The Democracy Reader

eventgrp.event: Visiting Fellow in Governmental Studies, Brookings Institution
Author, National Standards in American Education: A Citizen's Guide

chronitem.event: Held the Brown Chair in Education Studies, Brookings Institution
Author (with Chester E. Finn, Jr.), Education Reform, 1995-1996

eventgrp.event: Author, A Tribute to Al Shanker
Author (with Joseph P. Viteritti), New Schools for A New Century: The Redesign of Urban Education

chronitem.event: Member, National Assessment Government Board
Received the Horace Kidger Award of the New England History Teachers Association
Author, The American Reader: Words that Moved a Nation, and Left Back: A Century of Battles Over School Reform
Author (with Joseph P. Viteritti), Making good Citizens: Education and Civil Society
Elected, Eleanor Roosevelt Fellow of the American Academy of Political and Social Sciences

eventgrp.event: Author, The Language Police: How Pressure Groups Restrict What Students Learn
Author (with Joseph P. Viteritti), City Schools: Lessons from New York
Author (with Chester E. Finn, Jr.), The Mad Mad World of Textbook Adoption
Author, A Consumer Guide to High History Text Books
Author, Brookings Papers on Education Policy
Received the John Dewey Award from the United Federation of Teachers of New York City

chronitem.event: Author (with Michael Ravitch), The English Reader: What Every Literate Person Needs to Know
Author (with Chester E. Finn. Jr.), Beyond the Basics: Achieving a Liberal Education for All

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers of Diane Ravitch consist of correspondence, printed matter, reports, research materials, speeches and writings, and studies. They document her contributions to the cause of education in the United States. They reflect her efforts to set up standards for teaching and textbooks and deal with such issues as multiculturalism and bilingual education. They also bring to light the recognition she received outside the United States from European countries such as Poland.

Her papers have been kept in their original order. The audio-visual materials such as audio cassettes, CD Rom, diskettes, photographic prints, and VHS tapes have been arranged alphabetically by date and presented at the end of this guide.
The papers of Diane Ravitch were acquired by Hoover Institution Archives in 2003.

did.unittitle: 2 photographic prints depicting Diane Ravitch and other unidentified individuals

8 photographic prints depicting Diane Ravitch and other unidentified individuals assembled in different cities at different times participating in events to commemorate the Solidarity movement of 1956-1980,
1 photographic print depicting two young boys, Joshua (8 years old) and Trevor (4/1-2) years old,
1 photographic print depicting Fengshi Yang, Washington, D.C.,
Herman Badillo's Education Forum - Guest: Diane Ravitch,
School: The Story of American Public Education
"Improving History," Department of Education, Al Shanker,
"Reinventing Public School, episode 4, fine cut with titles,
Baruch College School of Public Affairs - "New York City's Public Schools Confront a New Year," parts 1 and 2,
